00021 SYLPH_BEGIN_NAMESPACE
00022 
00023 /*
00024  * This class provides a ready-to-use interface for exception handling. Unlike
00025  * most exception classes, you should not extend this class. Instead, use
00026  * the <code>sthrow</code> keyword to throw an Exception, like this:
00027  * <pre>void Foo::foobar(const Bar & bar) {
00028  *     if(bar.myint &lt; 0)
00029  *        sthrow(IllegalArgumentException,
00030  *           "Cannot foobar() when Bar::myint < 0");
00031  *     else {
00032  *       // ...
00033  *     }
00034  * }</pre>
00035  * <code>sthrow</code> will ensure that a Sylph::Core::Exception is thrown, even
00036  * when it is not in scope.
00037  * <code>sthrow</code> also adds certain debug information, i.e. file and line
00038  * numbers, if compilation with the debug flag (<code>-DSYLPH_DEBUG</code>) is
00039  * enabled. <p>
00040  * Note that in the example above, no class named
00041  * <code>IllegalArgumentException</code> actually exists. Instead, the name of
00042  * the Exception is stored in a String inside this class. Therefore, there are
00043  * no fixed Exception types, however, the following are recommended:
00044  * <ul>
00045  * <li> <code>ArrayException</code> -- A generic Exception thrown when trying
00046  * to access an item outside the bounds of an @c Array.</li>
00047  * <li> <code>FileException</code> -- A generic Exception thrown when a file is
00048  * is not of the supported type, e.g. a directory instead of a regular file.
00049  * When writing or reading from a file, throw an <code>IOException</code>
00050  * instead </li>
00051  * <li> <code>IllegalArgumentException</code> -- Similar to the
00052  * <code>IllegalStateException</code>, however, this Exception is meant
00053  * especially for arguments that do not conform to a given set of criteria,
00054  * where an <code>IllegalStateException</code> can also be thrown when certain
00055  * conditions, apart from arguments, are not met.</li>
00056  * <li> <code>IllegalStateException</code> -- The object on which to perform
00057  * the action is not in the right state, i.e. a variable does not have the right
00058  * value to perform te action.</li>
00059  * <li> <code>IOException</code> -- This Exception is thrown whenever an I/O
00060  * operation, such as a read or a write to a file, or establishing a network
00061  * connection, failed. </li>
00062  * <li> <code>NullPointerException</code> -- This Exception is thrown by the
00063  * <code>check_nullptr()</code> macro. Like it name says, it denotes the
00064  * dereference of a null (0) pointer. </li>
00065  * <li> <code>SerialisationException</code> -- This Exception is thrown by
00066  * @c Serializer s and @c Deserializer s when the type of the serialised object
00067  * and the destination don't match, or when the object could not be serialised
00068  * due to another Exception, such as an I/O error. </li>
00069  * <li> <code>TodoException</code> -- this Exception type denotes that the
00070  * operation itself is supported, but not yet implemented by the programmer,
00071  * a.k.a. LPS (Lazy Programmer Syndrome).
00072  * </li>
00073  * </ul>
00074  */
00075 class Exception : public virtual Object, public std::exception {
00076 public:
00082     Exception(String n, String r = String(""), String f = String("unknown"),
00083             const unsigned int l = 0)
00084     throw () : _name(n), _reason(r), _file(f), _line(l) {
00085     }
00086 
00090     ~Exception() throw () {
00091     }
00092 
00098     const char* what() const throw () {
00099         return _reason.ascii();
00100     }
00101 
00108     const String name() const throw () {
00109         return _name;
00110     }
00111 private:
00112     const String _name;
00113     const String _reason;
00114 public:
00115 #ifndef SYLPH_DOXYGEN
00116     const String _file;
00117     const unsigned int _line;
00118 #endif
00119 };
00120 
00121 SYLPH_END_NAMESPACE
00122 
00123 #ifdef SYLPH_DEBUG
00124 #define sthrow(__x, __r) throw Sylph::Exception(# __x, __r, __FILE__, __LINE__)
00125 #else
00126 #define sthrow(__x, __r) throw Sylph::Exception(# __x, __r)
00127 #endif
00128 
00129 #define if_nullptr(__x) if(__builtin_expect(!!(__x) == 0, 0))
00130 #define check_nullptr(__x) if_nullptr(__x) sthrow (NullPointerException, "Dereferenced a null pointer")
00131 #endif  /* EXCEPTION_H_ */
